key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to semiconductor shortages and logistics disruptions
Legal and regulatory risks, including patent infringement and compliance with energy efficiency standards
Intense market competition from low-cost manufacturers and rapid technological advancements
Reputation management challenges in balancing the Philips legacy with establishing a new brand identity
controversies: German court-ordered recall and destruction of certain products due to patent infringement
environmental_issues: Commitment to carbon neutrality and renewable electricity use
Advancement of circular economy practices, including recycling and waste reduction
social_issues: Responsible supply chain practices, including monitoring environmental impact and preventing human rights violations
governance_issues: Compliance with heavily regulated industry standards, including energy efficiency, environmental, and safety regulations

sources.title: Signify N.V. - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Signify N.V., formerly known as Philips Lighting N.V., is a Dutch multinational lighting corporation formed in 2016 as a result of the spin-off of the lighting division of Philips, by means of an IPO. [2] The company manufactures electric lights, light fixtures and control systems for consumers, professionals and the IoT.In 2018, Philips Lighting changed its name to Signify.
